article_title: How an 'avalanche of unnecessary medical care' is harming us — and what can be done about it

article_metadata.description: In a long and provocative article in the New Yorker, Dr. Atul Gawande focuses on the current “avalanche of unnecessary medical care [that] is harming patients physically and financially” in the United States.

og.description: Some diagnostic tests, like CT scans, can be harmful in themselves. But tests also lead, writes Dr. Atul Gawande in the New Yorker, to another major problem: overdiagnosis.
og.title: How an 'avalanche of unnecessary medical care' is harming us — and what can be done about it
